ratings.comment: Probably one of the best (if not the best) professors I've had.

Lectures on online. In class section has an advantage. Homework is tough, time-consuming, make sure not to fall behind. Very good professor, will take time to explain to students in class or during office hours.

The first month of the course you learn to use Maple and after the first midterm you learn to use MatLab. I know he is retiring soon but he is a very good teacher and nuclear engineer.  The entire class is spent working on problems with the programs and he lectures 5 minutes max and then will walk around and help you out and see where you are.

This class was supposed to be online but I opted to take it in person and wow what a difference. Prof. Moses only "lectured" for about 5 minutes for each lab but he came around and helped students the entire time which was nice for someone who never coded before. His instructions on the HW were a bit confusing sometimes but overall a pretty easy A
Avoids all possible math and makes lectures fairly useless.
Starts his online lectures with puppet shows. Often can be seen running across the WISCEL lab to assist a student. Nice guy who I would gladly take again.

Lectures are helpful and entertaining. He creates an effective balance between derivations and solving problems. Homework is very difficult, but the textbook is very, very in-depth and filled with equations. Exams were easy in comparison to the homework. He clearly cares about his students.

Probably the greatest professor in existence. You spend every class period doing homework problems in groups and he wanders around the room helping people. The lectures are online and are pretty hilarious. Exams are on the computer and I was able to get a 100 on all three without studying for a second.

Best professor I've ever had. Online lectures are hilarious. All you do in class is work in groups through the Maple/Matlab examples he wrote, and he wanders around the room helping everyone. Homework is also in groups and it's pretty similar to the examples. Exams are online. Some people thought it was hard, but I got an A with no effort at all.
good professor, knows what's going on. NE 271 is better than ComSic 310 because you have a smaller class and you take the exams on the computer and not paper.

The most helpful Prof I have ever had. The homework is extremely difficult and he takes the time in office hours to explain the material very thoroughly. He is very funny and approachable and wants his students to succeed. I can't wait to take a NEEP class from him.

It seems as if he'd be a really good professor, but the class sucks.  Lectures are online and they are useless. It is comparable to taking a class on how to use your calculator, only it's a complex calculator on the computer.  The tests have so many typos it's unbelievable.  You will spend half the exam wondering what it is supposed to say.

Tough subject material, but he dumbs it down just enough. Has weekly quizzes that are worth a lot. Homework is very hard, but then again this is nuclear engineering. Lecture is actually pretty useful, even though it's powerpoint.
Greg is... interesting.  He spices up the online lecture in ways that are .. decidedly strange (but enjoyable).  Exams are easy if you understand the homework/labs.

This is a pretty easy class. The lectures are online and the labs are graded by 2 really easy open book/note quizzes a week and attendance. If you dont understand something just ask. Moses is extremely helpful and will answer emails and meet with you if you need it. There's no reason anyone can't get and A in this class.

he is one of the best profs ive ever seen, its just a shame that the class was kind of a joke - lectures are online and there are 2 labs.. u learn how to use maple and matlab - the rest of the material is useless but u still have 2 know it.. you will get done with tests early but i recommend checking over everything cause its easy to get tricked
No Comments

Great Prof.  He wants to help you, you just have to ask.  The class requires a lot of outside work, but's it's do-able.  Homework takes a lot of time and isn't worth much.  Tests are fairly easy, but weighted heavily.  Stay above the average and the curve will help you a lot.
I've never seen some get so enthusiastic about Computer Science. This man has energy. He's very helpful. I have no complaints, this is a very easy class.
No Comments
